intro: Agropyron fragile var. sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian wheatgrass, is a perennial grass native to temperate regions of Asia and Europe. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit and fine, blue-green leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to yellow flowers. It is well adapted to cold climates and can thrive in poor soils. This species is often used in ecological restoration and as a forage crop due to its hardiness and resilience.
